data.title: Meet Our Wine & Culinary Experts
data.meta_description: Join Early Mountain Vineyards' expert wine and culinary team, where passion for Virginia viticulture meets career opportunity
data.text:
Community & Wine Club Manager

The Community & Wine Club Manager will be responsible for managing the Early Mountain Wine Clubs and work in tandem with the Director of Marketing to oversee E-Commerce Sales. The Club management component is a priority as we feel there is room for revenue growth and opportunities to strengthen the bond with members. Additionally, the Community Manager will actively mine data and communicate with other department heads to share information and optimize sales and retention strategies. This individual will also play a part with other key stakeholders to develop annual production strategy. The Community Manager reports directly to the General Manager and Director of Marketing. Wine Club Management · Manage all aspects of quarterly wine shipments, from communication to processing to fulfillment. · Craft top-notch promotional strategies to gain new members throughout the course of the year. · Address retention by implementing creative and informed programs that improve the connection between EMV and club members. · Work with the Director of Wine & Hospitality to increase conversions, improve sales tactics among tasting room associates, and design creative incentives to boost club membership. · Work with the events team, culinary team, and tasting room team to coordinate and execute club weekends and corresponding events. Ensure club weekends are optimized both in terms of revenue generation and appropriate programming that will increase affinity. · Coordinate with the Head Winemaker on selections for the 1784 wine club, and work with our leadership team to select interesting Virginia wines for the Taste of Virginia Club. · Manage and assess all aspects of our shipping fulfillment partner. Manage all internal packing of club orders. · In tandem with the Director of Marketing, manage all aspects of communication for the wine club, including wine release emails, reminder emails, being the point of contact for all club related issues from members, coordinating quarterly collateral development (e.g., wine club letters and recipe cards, etc.) · Create and distribute quarterly wine club reports and operational summaries to the executive and accounting team. Use detailed analysis to spot trends. · Create an annual plan for wine club initiatives and contribute to development of the annual budget with the Director of Marketing and executive team. · Stay abreast of best-in-class wine club practices and implement tactics that distinguish our club. · Inventory packing and shipping supplies to ensure we are always prepared. Additionally, keep an eye on supply costs to see if we can reduce overhead. E-Commerce · Work with the Director of Marketing to drive revenue through digital channels including our online shop and innovative channels. · Oversee execution of e-commerce orders, ensuring accurate fulfillment by our packing associate(s). · Manage inventory of EMV SKUs, packing materials, etc. · Work with the Director of Marketing on promotional planning and campaigns, including product creation, social media promotion, and email design. · Keep the Early Mountain online store up to date, well-designed, beautiful, and shoppable. Always work to improve the shopping experience. · Ensure online fulfillment is being managed and executed efficiently and accurately. Compliance and Administration · Serve as the compliance check-point before launch to consumer; all products need to be appropriately set up in TTB and point of sale system. ·Review inventory monthly to keep business units in the loop on overages or upcoming out-of-stock SKUs. · Complete the Item Set Up of new SKU’s and import all corresponding information into the point-of-sale system. · Familiarize and follow all laws set for farm wineries by the Virginia ABC/TTB Analytics · Prepare monthly reports on email campaigns, Google Analytics, and social media. Serve as point of contact on data mining and analysis- especially those related to club and online sales. · Leverage weekly reporting to advise teams on the performance of key business metrics. Share data across relevant business units that will allow EMV to improve Direct to Consumer sales. Miscellaneous · Ongoing ability to work select weekends and evening that are important for Member Club to bolster acquisition and improve performance. · Assist the Director of Marketing with social media projects as time allows. It is understood that there will be periods of time when all effort will be required for club processing, but in those instances when club activities are less significant bandwidth will be used for marketing activities. · Maintain a clean and organized packing/storage space on the property. · Stay educated about the world of wine, both in styles and varietals and continue to pursue wine assessment knowledge. Key Qualifications and Experience: - BA and 1-2 years of experience in digital marketing - Understanding of social media as a means to build community, brand affinity and loyalty - Gregarious, outgoing personality with a confident digital, phone, and in person communication - Strong design aesthetic and skills - Excellent written communication skills - A passion for hospitality and fulfilling the needs of our customers - Eagerness and ability to adapt and learn quickly - Resourceful in analyzing data and making data-led decisions - Organized, determined and results oriented - Computer literacy required: Microsoft & Google suite - Social Media literacy and experience - Must possess a current driver’s license - Must be able to repeatedly lift 45 pounds. About Early Mountain Vineyards We are a fun, talented and growing team dedicated to providing our customers and community with exceptional service and a Virginian brand of Southern hospitality. We move at a very fast pace and rely on entrepreneurial initiative and creative drive to make things happen. We are also committed to maintaining a family-oriented work environment and championing the overall Virginia wine and food community. A passion for food and wine, dedication to building positive relationships in our community and a fun environment are building blocks of our team dynamic. We offer a balanced, healthy lifestyle with reasonable hours, competitive salary + bonus and full benefits. Early Mountain Vineyards is located in Madison, Virginia in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains. With a strong commitment to the vineyard as well as a fervent expression of place, our mission is to craft high-quality wines and to support Virginia’s ascent as a world-class wine region. Early Mountain Vineyards is owned by Jean Case and her husband, Steve, and is located at 6109 Wolftown-Hood Road, Madison, Virginia 22727. For additional information, please visit http://earlymountain.com.

Part Time / Full Time - Line and Prep Cook

Summary of Position: Line/Prep Cook must demonstrate ability to efficiently set up and execute stations as needed, assist the culinary team with daily prep tasks and make cleanliness, sanitation and organization high priority. Line/Prep Cook is responsible for the final presentation of plating as directed by Executive Chef – accuracy and consistency are key. Cultivating a positive and creative working environment is an essential part of our culinary department’s vision and growth. These positions offer a competitive hourly rate. Essential Functions: Learn and remain familiar with all menu items: including all components of each menu item and how they are prepared. All Culinary team members are responsible for maintaining proper holding and heating temperatures, FIFO, organization of station & walk in space. Review prep list, check daily pars and maintain pars as necessary, and ensure all food items are dated and up to company standards. Know and comply with cooking methods, quality standards as well as rules, policies and procedures. Keep a clean and sanitary work station, including all cooking equipment, tables, shelves and refrigeration equipment. Inspect equipment before and after use, making sure everything is clean and in proper working order. Prepare all menu items with acute attention to detail while balancing the quick upbeat energy of a fast-paced environment. Follow all opening and closing checklists to ensure that kitchen is closed safely and properly. Maintain a positive and professional rapport with all coworkers and guests. Perform other related duties as assigned by Executive Chef, Chef de Cuisine and/or Sous Chef. Qualifications Minimum 1-2 years’ experience, or at least 6 months experience in a similar capacity. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with all personnel. Must be able to lift 40 lbs regularly, as well as bend, stoop and reach, as well as remain standing for as many as 12 hours. Follow all recipes & plating specifications as directed. Maintain personal hygiene standards in accordance with Virginia State Health Standards for Food Service Employees. Please submit your resume via email to JOBS@EARLYMOUNTAIN.COM
